title: Halfe a dozen of good vvives All for a penny. Kind cozens or country-men what ere you be, if you want a good penny-worth, come buy it of me, sixe wives for a penny, a young one or old, a cleanely good huswife, a slut or a scold. To the tune of, The cleane contrary way.
publisher: [by E. Purslowe] for F. C[oules] dwelling in the Old-Bayly,
notes: Names in imprint and suggested publication date from STC.
In two parts; woodcuts at head of each part.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
